question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration. Develop an Eight-Characters (BaZi) fortune telling software using index.vue in uni-app with BuilderX that can calculate birth eight characters, major life cycles, yearly fortune and other information. Please provide me with the complete code. I am a beginner, so the process should be detailed.

checklist.title: Is the Eight-Characters (BaZi) calculation core accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code implements accurate Chinese lunar calendar conversion, celestial stems and earthly branches calculation, and the Four Pillars formation (year, month, day, hour). Score 0 if core BaZi calculations are missing, 5 if basic calculations are implemented with minor inaccuracies, and 10 if the implementation includes all traditional calculation methods with leap month handling.

checklist.title: Are the major life cycles (Da Yun) calculations properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code correctly calculates starting ages for major life cycles, properly implements the 10-year cycles based on gender differences, and accurately displays favorable/unfavorable periods. Deduct 5 points if gender-specific calculations are missing, and 3 points if cycle transitions are incorrectly handled. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the yearly fortune (Nian Yun) prediction system comprehensive?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes annual luck predictions with flowing stems and branches (Liu Nian), clash and combination relationships between elements, and specific life aspect predictions. Deduct 5 points if only basic yearly stems/branches are shown without interpretations, and 3 points if seasonal transitions are not considered. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the Five Elements analysis and interpretation complete?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code provides accurate analysis of the user's Five Elements (Wu Xing) composition, identifies day master strength, favorable/unfavorable elements, and offers personalized recommendations. Score 0 if Five Elements analysis is missing, 5 if basic analysis is provided without personalization, and 10 if the implementation includes detailed interpretations with balancing suggestions.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid date inputs, future dates, edge case birth times, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Visual elemental charts 2. Compatibility analysis between two BaZi charts 3. Interactive explanations of terms). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar calculation methods 2. Function modules unrelated to BaZi fortune telling (e.g., irrelevant horoscopes) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating calculation logic/view/data layers), appropriate use of uni-app components, and BuilderX integration. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if BuilderX features are not properly utilized. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows traditional Chinese aesthetics with modern UI principles: 1) Harmonious color matching reflecting Five Elements theory 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system with appropriate classical Chinese typography. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay â‰¤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance when switching between different fortune telling aspects. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
